channel.title: How To Change Firecape Texture
channel.description:
[b]Difficulty[/b] 2/10 [b](My first Tutorial)[/b] [img]http://img832.imageshack.us/img832/2507/tutg.png[/img][img]http://img828.imageshack.us/img828/7969/hd2.png[/img] [b]Equipment needed to use this:[/b] -Tom's Cache editor - http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5 mirror 2: http://uppit.com/v/OXZC027G -Your Client -Your Cache
[b]Step 1[/b] - Loading your cache onto Tom's Cache Editor:
-Loading your cache onto Tom's Cache Editor is very easy, no skill required, simply Open the editor, and a small screen SHOULD pop up. An easy route to get to open this is Cache-Suit>Trunk>Suite>Open Suite.jar. [img]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/1778/090905163435.png[/img]
[b]Step 2[/b] - Using the Cache editor
-Now at the top right, click, File, Load Cache, now go to your client, open client, then cache,now "OPEN" Cache, [img]http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/1109/tut2j.png[/img] now some option should open up on the editor choose "View/Edit Image Archives". [img]http://img709.imageshack.us/img709/713/tut3h.png[/img]
[b]Step 3[/b] - Changing the Texture Time for the fun part!
Now you should see a bunch of Picture choose the firecape Texture for Example mine is 40.dat click import and now choose which firecape texture u want [img]http://img215.imageshack.us/img215/8454/tut4j.png[/img]
[b]HD FIRECAPE DOWNLOAD:[/b]http://img215.imageshack.us/img215/8454/tut4j.png [b]FIRECAPE CLASSIC:[/b]http://uppit.com/wcjxlfna3jpw/Firecape.zip
[b]Step 4[/b] - Reloading Your Cache
When your done changing your colours you now may click at the bottom "Save Config", when your done that, it will say "archive repacked succesfully". Now reload ur client and u cape should be differnt
-Hope this helps- Jkicool :)
-If wrong spot Mod please move-

item.title: How To Change Firecape Texture
item.dc:creator: @jkicool jkicool
item.description:
@jkicool wrote:

Difficulty 2/10
(My first Tutorial)

Equipment needed to use this:
-Tom’s Cache editor - http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5
mirror 2: http://uppit.com/v/OXZC027G
-Your Client
-Your Cache

Step 1 - Loading your cache onto Tom’s Cache Editor:

-Loading your cache onto Tom’s Cache Editor is very easy, no skill required, simply Open the editor, and a small screen SHOULD pop up.
An easy route to get to open this is Cache-Suit>Trunk>Suite>Open Suite.jar.

Step 2 - Using the Cache editor

-Now at the top right, click, File, Load Cache, now go to your client, open client, then cache,now “OPEN” Cache,

now some option should open up on the editor choose “View/Edit Image Archives”.

Step 3 - Changing the Texture
Time for the fun part!

Now you should see a bunch of Picture choose the firecape Texture for Example mine is 40.dat click import and now choose which firecape texture u want

HD FIRECAPE DOWNLOAD:http://img215.imageshack.us/img215/8454/tut4j.png
FIRECAPE CLASSIC:http://uppit.com/wcjxlfna3jpw/Firecape.zip

Step 4 - Reloading Your Cache

When your done changing your colours you now may click at the bottom “Save Config”, when your done that, it will say “archive repacked succesfully”. Now reload ur client and u cape should be differnt

-Hope this helps-
Jkicool

-If wrong spot Mod please move-

Read full topic
